briefdescription.para: Contructor for the community linking to Treenode list.

parameterdescription.para: Row of TreeNode objects to link to.

briefdescription.para: Default constructor.
Default destructor.
Set the nodes object to the input Row of Treenode objects.

parameterdescription.para: the Row of Treenode objects to link to.

briefdescription.para: Sets the database object for the sqlite functions.

parameterdescription.para: the sqlite3 input database.

briefdescription.para: Get the boolean of whether the data has been imported yet.

simplesect.para: true if database has been imported.

briefdescription.para: Get the minimum speciation rate the simulation was originally run with. This value is read in from the SIMULATION_PARAMETERS table in the database file.

simplesect.para: the minimum speciation rate.

briefdescription.para: Imports the samplemask if it hasn't already been imported.

parameterdescription.para: the path to the samplemask file.

briefdescription.para: Counts the number of species that have speciated currently on the tree.

simplesect.para: the number of species

briefdescription.para: Calculate the number of species in the list for the parameters in the current_community_parameters object. This is the main function which reconstructs the coalescence tree. Each Treenode object will end having its existence value set correctly after a call to this function.

simplesect.para: the number of species present.

briefdescription.para: Speciates TreeNode and updates the species count.

detaileddescription.para: For systems which are not using a metacommunity, this function will just perform basic speciation.

simplesect.para: species_list is not updated in unless the function is overridden for metacommunity application.

parameterdescription.para: the total number of species currently in the community
pointer to the TreeNode object for this lineage
the set of all species ids.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the species abundance of the dataset. The species abundances will be with rOut after a call do this function. If a samplemask has been applied, only lineages which originally existed in the samplemask will be counted.
Resets the entire tree. Sets existance to false, speciation to false and removes any species ID.
This function detects the maximum x and y values of the sql database. This allows for the dimensions before opening the map file.

xrefdescription.para: This function is deprecated as of 08/2016 due to simulation parameters being stored in the SQL database.
If species do not exist across the whole range of the samplemask, samplemask size will not be set correctly and samplemask referencing may be incorrect.

parameterdescription.para: the path to the input database to read from.

briefdescription.para: Opens the connection to the sql database file Note that this imports the database to memory, so functionality should be changed for extremely large database files.

parameterdescription.para: the sql database output from a NECSim simulation.

briefdescription.para: Opens a connection to an in-memory database. This will eventually be written to the output file.
Internally sets the file referencing, data import and sql connection flags to true, for allowing checks to pass from internal object creation (so no external files are needed)
Imports the data from the desired SQL database object into the array.

simplesect.para: Opens the sql connection if it has not already been opened.
If nodes is not of length 0, this function does nothing. This is so that any in-memory data is not overwritten.

parameterdescription.para: the path to the input SQLite database.

briefdescription.para: Imports the simulation parameters by reading the SIMULATION_PARAMETERS table in the provided file. This imports the grid_x_size, grid_y_size (which should also be the sample map dimensions) and the minimum speciation rate.

simplesect.para: Opens the sql connection if it has not already been opened.
If bDataImport has already been set, no operation is performed.

parameterdescription.para: the sqlite database simulation output which will be used for coalescence tree generation.

briefdescription.para: Gets the maximum species abundance ID from the database and stores it in the max_species_id variable.

simplesect.para: Does not check for SPECIES_ABUNDANCES existence and will throw an error if it cannot access it

briefdescription.para: Changes the rOut object so that values represent cummulative species abundances.

detaileddescription.para:
Allows binary sort on rOut (much faster) and the previous rOut value can be obtained by value = rOut[i] - rOut[i-1]
pointer to sorted Row of species abundances

briefdescription.para: Returns the row_out object, which should contain species abundances or cumulative abundances.

simplesect.para: Does not recalculate species abundances, so if getCumulativeAbundances has been called, will return the cumulative species abundances instead.
Returns a copy, so could cause problems for extremely large simulations with immense numbers of species.
row_out, the species abundances, or the cumulative abundances if getCumulativeAbundances has been called

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of species in the most recent calculation.

simplesect.para: the number of species in the most recent calculation

briefdescription.para: Gets the maximum fragment abundance ID from the database and stores it in the max_fragment_id variable.

simplesect.para: Does not check for FRAGMENT_ABUNDANCES existence and will throw an error if it cannot access it

briefdescription.para: Gets the maximum species locations ID from the database and stores it in the max_locations_id variable.

simplesect.para: Does not check for SPECIES_LOCATIONS existence and will throw an error if it cannot access it

briefdescription.para: Sets the protracted parameters for application of protracted speciation.

parameterdescription.para: the maximum number of generations a lineage can exist for before speciating

briefdescription.para: Sets the protracted parameters for application of protracted speciation.

detaileddescription.para: This overloaded version is for setting protracted parameters before a full simulation has been outputted (i.e. immediately after completion of the simulation).

parameterdescription.para: the maximum number of generations a lineage can exist for before speciating
the minimum number of generations a lineage must exist before speciating.

briefdescription.para: Sets the protracted boolean to the input.

parameterdescription.para: the protracted boolean to set

briefdescription.para: Creates a new table in the database file and outputs the database object to the same file as the input file. Calculates the community structure for the set of community parameters in current_community_parameters.

detaileddescription.para: The new SPECIES_ABUNDANCES table contains the species abundance distribution for the whole samplemask. A similar tabe FRAGMENT_ABUNDANCES is generated by createFragmentDatabase() if specified via the command line parameters.

briefdescription.para: Calls calcSpecies and calcSpeciesAbundances to generate the coalescence tree and calculate species abundances.
Outputs the species abundances into the database.

memberdef.argsstring: (long double speciation_rate, double time, bool fragments, unsigned long metacommunity_size, long double metacommunity_speciation_rate)
memberdef.name: checkCalculationsPerformed

briefdescription.para: Checks if calculations with the given set of parameters has already been performed.

parameterdescription.para: the speciation rate to check for
the time to check for
if true, checks fragments have been used
the metacommunity size to check for
the metacommunity speciation rate to check for

memberdef.argsstring: (long double speciation_rate, double time, bool fragments, unsigned long metacommunity_size, long double metacommunity_speciation_rate)
memberdef.name: addCalculationPerformed

briefdescription.para: Adds a performed calculation to the lists of calculations. Also sets the current_community_parameters pointer to the set of parameters to be applied.

parameterdescription.para: the speciation rate of the performed calculation
the time of the performed calculation
if true, fragments were used
the metacommunity size of the performed calculation
the metacommunity speciation rate of the performed calculation

briefdescription.para: Creates a new table in the database file and outputs the database object to the same file as the input file. Essentially creates a species abundance distribution (as in createDatabase()), but for the specified fragment within the samplemask.

parameterdescription.para: the Fragment to sample from.

briefdescription.para: Output the database from memory to the database file. Most of the time, it is desirable for the outputfile to be the same path as the input file and will write to the same object.

parameterdescription.para: the path to the output file.

briefdescription.para: Checks for the current CommunityParameters reference in the SPECIES_LOCATIONS table.

simplesect.para: true if the reference exists in the SPECIES_LOCATIONS table

briefdescription.para: Checks for the current CommunityParameters reference in the SPECIES_ABUNDANCES table.

simplesect.para: return true if the reference exists in the SPECIES_LOCATIONS table

briefdescription.para: Record the full spatial data. Creates a new table, SPECIES_LOCATIONS containing every species and their parameters. This allows for more in-depth analysis to be performed if necessary.
Calculates the limits of each fragment in the sample map and adds it to the vector of fragments. If the fragment_file is null, then the program will attempt to calculate fragments from the map.

xrefdescription.para: Only rectangular fragments will be detected. Problems will also be encountered for adjacent fragments.

parameterdescription.para: the fragment file to read from.

briefdescription.para: Calculate species abundances for each fragment, and call createFragmentDatabase() for each Fragment.
Gets the previous calculations that have already been performed.
Gets the unique community references from the SQL database.

simplesect.para: a vector containing the unique references

briefdescription.para: Gets the unique metacommunity reference from the SQL database.

simplesect.para: a vector containing the unique references

briefdescription.para: Write all performed calculations to the output database.
Write all performed calculations to the output database.
Updates the fragments tag on those simulations which now have had fragments added.
Prints speciation rates to terminal.
Calculates the coalescence tree for each set of parameters in speciation_parameters;.
Outputs the data to the SQL database.

parameterdescription.para: the path to the sql database to output to

briefdescription.para: Prints the application times.

parameterdescription.para: the start time
the end time

briefdescription.para: Apply the given speciation parameters to the coalescence tree. Overridden for metacommunity application.

parameterdescription.para: speciation parameters to apply, including speciation rate, times and spatial sampling procedure

briefdescription.para: Creates the coalescence tree for the given speciation parameters.

parameterdescription.para: speciation parameters to apply, including speciation rate, times and spatial sampling procedure

briefdescription.para: Creates the coalescence tree for the given speciation parameters.

parameterdescription.para: speciation parameters to apply, including speciation rate, times and spatial sampling procedure
the Row of TreeNodes that contains the coalescence tree.

briefdescription.para: Creates the coalescence tree for the given speciation parameters, using internal file referencing to avoid any actual file creation.

parameterdescription.para: speciation parameters to apply, including speciation rate, times and spatial sampling procedure
the Row of TreeNodes that contains the coalescence tree.

briefdescription.para: A class to contain the tree object lineages and reconstructing the coalescence tree. Contains functions for calculating the number of species for a given speciation rate, outputting spatial data and generating species abundance distributions. Requires a link to the SQLite database from simulation output, and produces results within the same database file.
